Title:
New species of Discosia rhododendronicola, Neopestalotiopsis
rhododendronicola and new geographical record of Diaporthe nobilis from
Rhododendron sp.
Abstract:
In this study, we report new asexual fungal species,
Discosia rhododendronicola, Neopestalotiopsis rhododendronicola
(Sporocadaceae) and a new geographical record of Diaporthe nobilis
(Diaporthaceae). All species were isolated from Rhododendron sp. in
Kunming, Yunnan Province, China. All taxa are described based on
morphology and DNA sequence data analyzed to infer their phylogenetic
relationships. A multigene phylogenetic analysis based on LSU, ITS,
RPB2, TEF1 and TUB2 sequence data indicate that Discosia
rhododendronicola is closely related to Discosia muscicola.
Neopestalotiopsis rhododendronicola and Diaporthe nobilis, reported
herein as a new geographical record for China and its phylogeny is
depicted based on ITS, TEF1 and TUB2 sequence data.
